def new_schema_cast_columns(old_schema:dict, new_schema:str, db_name:str, table_name:str):
    '''
    '''
    import logging 
    logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    spark.conf.set("spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled", "true")

    import json
    new_fields = json.loads(new_schema)['fields']
    old_fields = old_schema['fields']

    column_type_changed = {}
    for new_field in new_fields:
        for old_field in old_fields:
            if old_field['name'] == new_field['name'] and old_field['type'] != new_field['type']:
                column_type_changed.update(dict({old_field['name']: new_field['type']}))
    if column_type_changed != {}:
        logger.info("detected column type changes, attempting to cast")
        from pyspark.sql.functions import col
        # load to dataframe, change types
        df = spark.read.format('delta').table(f'{db_name}.{table_name}')
        for column in column_type_changed:
            df = df.withColumn(column,col(column).cast(column_type_changed[column]))
        
        # save df with new types overwriting the schema
        df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").option("overwriteSchema",True).saveAsTable(f'{db_name}.{table_name}')
    else:
        logger.info("no columns have changed type")

def apply_new_schema(db_name: str, table_name: str):
    '''
    Description:
        - uses a database and table name to detect any new json schema that has been uploaded and changes column types and adds new columns as appropriate
        - does not remove columns (doesn't matter)
        - can't change column names 

    Arguments:
        - db_name, one of odw_config_db, odw_standardised_db, odw_harmonised_db or odw_curated_db

    Actions:
        - Changes column types according to new schema, and adds new columns according to new schema
    
    Returns:
        - Nothing

    Exceptions:

    '''
    # import modules
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType
    import json
    import logging 
    from delta.tables import DeltaTable

    # initialising logging and spark session
    logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    spark.conf.set("spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled", "true")

    # accessing environment variables for storage container
    storage_acc_name = spark.sparkContext.environment.get('dataLakeAccountName', 'get')
    storage_account= storage_acc_name + ".dfs.core.windows.net"
    config_storage_container = 'abfss://odw-config@' + storage_account + '/'
    
    # standardised db schema locations are in the orchestration.json file
    if db_name.lower() == 'odw_standardised_db':
        orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration.json", wholetext=True).first().value
        json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
        try:
            schema_location = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/" + next(config['Standardised_Table_Definition'] for config in json_config_dict['definitions'] if config['Standardised_Table_Name'] == table_name)
            schema = spark.read.text(schema_location, wholetext=True).first().value
        except StopIteration:
            logger.info("Table Schema not found where expected")
            raise RuntimeError("Table Schema not found where expected")

    # harmonised schema locations are in the config container in similarly named folders
    elif db_name.lower() == 'odw_harmonised_db' or db_name.lower() == 'odw_curated_db':
        db_name_folder_mapping = dict({'odw_harmonised_db':'harmonised', 'odw_curated_db':'curated'})
        folder = db_name_folder_mapping[db_name.lower()]
        try:
            schema_location = next(file.path for file in mssparkutils.fs.ls("abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/"+ folder +"_table_definitions/") if file.name.lower().split('.json')[0] == table_name)
            schema = spark.read.text(schema_location, wholetext=True).first().value
        except StopIteration:
            logger.info("Table Schema not found where expected")
            raise RuntimeError("Table Schema not found where expected")

    # config db schemas are located in the config account but in unique locations
    elif db_name.lower() == 'odw_config_db':
        if table_name.lower() == 'datalabs_log':
            schema = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/raw_logs/datalabs_log_json/fileshare_log_schema.json"
        elif table_name.lower() == 'raw_to_std_outstanding_files':
            schema = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/scheduling_outstanding_files_table.json"
        else:
            raise RuntimeError("No Schema Found")

    # check the table to see if there are any changes in the schema at all
    current_json_str = spark.read.format('delta').table(f'{db_name}.{table_name}').schema.jsonValue()    

    # delta spark engine does not enforce nullability - i have tested this a lot and the databricks forums and github imply this is on purpose...
    current_json_no_null = current_json_str
    [field.pop('nullable') for field in current_json_no_null['fields']]

    schema_no_null = json.loads(schema)
    [field.pop('nullable') for field in schema_no_null['fields']]

    current_table_schema = json.dumps(current_json_no_null['fields'], sort_keys=True)
    latest_json_schema = json.dumps(schema_no_null['fields'], sort_keys=True)

    if current_table_schema == latest_json_schema:
        logger.info("no changes in schema")
    else:
        # get the last stable table version in case we need to rollback
        from delta.tables import DeltaTable
        table_location = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE DETAIL {db_name}.{table_name}").toPandas()['location'][0]
        delta_table = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, table_location)
        fullHistoryDF = delta_table.history()
        last_stable_version = fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
        try:
            # attempt to cast existing columns with new column type
            logger.info("casting columns")
            new_schema_cast_columns(current_json_str, schema, db_name, table_name)
        except Exception as e:
            # if casting fails, raise error and restore to last stable version in case any transactions have happened
            logger.info("casting columns failed")
            delta_table.restoreToVersion(last_stable_version)
            raise e

        
        # if successful, add new columns from new schema schema 
        try:
            logger.info("adding new columns")
            new_struct = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(schema))
            spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
            spark.conf.set("spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled", "true")
            df = spark.createDataFrame([], new_struct)
            df.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").mode("append").format('delta').saveAsTable(f'{db_name}.{table_name}')
        except Exception as e:
            # if adding new columns, raise error and restore to last stable version in case any transactions have happened
            delta_table.restoreToVersion(last_stable_version)
            logger.info("Failed to apply new schema, have rolled backed changes")
            raise e
